description: This course reconstructs the archaeology and history of ancient Israel from the earliest times until Alexander the Great's conquest in 332 BCE. Particular emphasis will be placed on the material culture of the Levant as a way to understand the culture and society of ancient Israel from commoner to courtier. Topics of study include ritual and the religious cult, sacrifice and monotheism, ceramics and stone vessels, trade and empire in the Chacolithic, Bronze and Iron Ages of the Levant. Field trips to the University of Pennsylvania Museum are an important component of this course.
name: ARCHY & HIST ANC ISRAEL
